<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/01/name-image-likeness-relaxations-creates-new-industry-overnight?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The College Athlete Gold Rush Is Here
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="College sports fans dancing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=375 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/hHTLJpBn139IpZgb6X/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="College sports fans dancing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/hHTLJpBn139IpZgb6X/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thursday at midnight, a new billion-dollar industry was created out of thin air.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The relaxation of rules governing name, image, and likeness (NIL) allows college athletes to sign endorsement deals and make money off their fame for the first time, resulting in a “transcendent day for American sports,” Sports Illustrated <a href="https://www.si.com/college/2021/07/01/ncaa-athletes-profit-nil-daily-cover?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How did we get here? </strong>25 states passed NIL bills that challenged the NCAA’s rules banning student athletes from monetizing their popularity. Seeing the writing on the wall, the NCAA lifted its restrictions on NIL on Wednesday, paving the way for college athletes to link up with brands just hours later.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">They didn’t waste any time</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An entire roster of college athletes took advantage of the new NIL rules yesterday to launch their business careers.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Twin sisters who play for Fresno State’s basketball team are the newest </span><span><a href="https://www.espn.com/college-sports/story/_/id/31738893/ncaa-athletes-cashing-name-image-likeness?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spokespeople</a></span><span> for Boost Mobile.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Wisconsin’s starting QB Graham Mertz released a </span><span><a href="https://www.buckys5thquarter.com/2021/6/28/22554417/graham-mertz-has-a-logo-now-like-a-danged-superhero-nil-name-image-likeness-wisconsin-badgers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">personal logo</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Arkansas WR Trey Knox and his incredibly good-looking dog, Blue, </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/FOS/status/1410689170306174976?s=09" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">inked a deal</a></span><span> with PetSmart.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re thinking NIL will mostly benefit the biggest stars in the biggest sports (football, basketball), you wouldn’t be wrong. But there are plenty of exceptions for the most social media-savvy athletes.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For example, industry insiders expect LSU gymnast Olivia Dunne to earn the most of any NCAA athlete from NIL endorsements. She’s the only one with more than 1 million followers on both TikTok and Instagram.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In total, the NIL market could hit <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/oliviaevans/2021/06/24/college-athletes-are-ready-to-reap-the-rewards-of-the-billion-dollar-nil-market-opendorse-is-here-to-help/?sh=477aee164f57" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$500 million</a> in 2022 and $1 billion/year annually after that, per athlete marketing platform Opendorse. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s next? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To borrow a sports metaphor, we’re in the <em>very </em>early innings of NIL, so expect chaos. The NCAA’s decision has left a confusing patchwork of state laws governing NIL, and everyone’s waiting on Congress to pass a federal bill that establishes nationwide guidelines. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Further NIL reading: </strong>The <a href="https://www.actionnetwork.com/ncaab/ranking-top-20-college-athletes-favorites-capitalize-name-image-likeness-july-1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top 20 athletes</a> who could capitalize on NIL and the <a href="https://www.espn.com/espn/feature/story/_/id/29388424/how-much-money-college-athletes-make-nil-rights?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earning potential</a> of athletes across sports and endorsement deals.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IPO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/01/robinhood-announces-ipo-70-million-finra-fine?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Back Again With Another Realistic Robinhood Haul
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/01/robinhood-announces-ipo-70-million-finra-fine?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Robinhood illustration " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTI3L3JvYmluaG9vZF9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Less than 48 hours after <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/finra-levies-robinhood-biggest-fine-ever?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agreeing</a> to pay the biggest fine ever in Finra history, Robinhood said “k” and <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/01/investing/robinhood-ipo/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed</a> to go public. The trading app will list its shares under the symbol HOOD in an IPO that reflects the growing influence of the individual trader on Wall Street.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Right now, it’s good to be the HOOD.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Robinhood’s revenue </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/online-brokerage-robinhood-makes-ipo-filing-public-2021-07-01/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surged to $959 million</a></span><span> in 2020, a 245% jump from 2019. It also turned a profit for the first time last year amid a pandemic-fueled trading boom.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Interest in crypto has been lucrative: Crypto-related transactions accounted for 17% of Robinhood’s total revenue in Q1.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Things can get meta when you have a stock brokerage list shares. For instance, Robinhood wants you to buy into Robinhood’s IPO on Robinhood. In an unusual move, it’s setting aside 20%–35% of its Class A stock for its customers, as opposed to bankers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Robinhood’s highly anticipated IPO is the belle of the ball on a packed dance floor. US-listed IPOs have already raised over <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/robinhood-ipo-filing-shows-power-of-the-meme-stock-boom-11625163113?mod=hp_lead_pos7" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$190 billion</a> so far in 2021, more than 2020’s total.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAX
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/01/130-countries-agree-global-minimum-corporate-tax-rate?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Race to the Bottom Could Be Over
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/01/130-countries-agree-global-minimum-corporate-tax-rate?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='An illustration of a Monopoly board. The space for taxes shows "Corporate Tax: Pay 21% or $200" with the 21% crossed out in red pen and 28% written beside it. ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDAzL2NvcnBvcmF0ZV90YXhlcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the past 30 years, countries have lowered their corporate tax rates to lure companies to their shores. That race may be rounding its final turn.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/01/business/global-minimum-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> yesterday that a group of 130 nations, including China and India, have agreed to a 15% global minimum corporate tax. After taking effect in 2023, it will be the biggest change to the international tax system in a century. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Under a global minimum tax, multinational corporations would theoretically stop moving their headquarters to tax havens like the British Virgin Islands and Bermuda. Raising rates from the single-digits to at least 15% in those havens will generate $150 billion in additional tax revenue per year, according to the OECD.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Today’s agreement by 130 countries representing more than 90% of global GDP is a clear sign: the race to the bottom is one step closer to coming to an end,” Yellen </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/SecYellen/status/1410624464799375360?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For President Biden, the minimum tax agreement is a crucial step to make multinational companies pay significantly more in US taxes, which will help fund his ambitious spending plans. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This was the international community’s answer to the complicated question of how to tax tech giants, like Google and Facebook, which have substantial sales in countries they have no physical presence in.</p>

SPONSORED BY WALMART
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yes, a <a href="https://www.walmart.com/plus?cn=FY21-wpl-content-aff-gen-fs&irgwc=1&sourceid=imp_yjXUpFX2nxyOWNfwUx0Mo38MUkB1A1WlyyuFQY0&veh=aff&wmlspartner=imp_2578951&clickid=yjXUpFX2nxyOWNfwUx0Mo38MUkB1A1WlyyuFQY0&sharedid=placement6&affiliates_ad_id=897011&campaign_id=9383" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Walmart+</a> membership saves you <strong style="color:#000">so much time and money</strong>, it frankly should be housed in a museum alongside other beautiful works of art.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But reader, the beautiful savings do not stop there. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">ZERO DOLLARS. Take your water lilies and your sunflowers. We’ll take some sweet Walmart+ savings, thanks.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Wally Funk, 82, will become the <a href="https://apnews.com/article/tx-state-wire-jeff-bezos-science-2b7f734eecefea80de8c1c5eebf239ee?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">oldest person to go to space</a> after being asked by Jeff Bezos to accompany him on the Blue Origin mission July 20. Funk is a member of the Mercury 13, a group of women who were put through rigorous astronaut training in the 1960s before the program was canceled.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “Nothing has ever gotten in my way. They said, well, you’re a girl, you can’t do that. I said, guess what, doesn’t matter what you are. You can still do it if you want to do it and I like to do things that nobody has ever done.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—Wally Funk</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Joe Rogan is too big to cancel. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThursday at midnight, a new billion-dollar industry was created out of thin air.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe relaxation of rules governing name, image, and likeness (NIL) allows college athletes to sign endorsement deals and make money off their fame for the first time, resulting in a “transcendent day for American sports,” Sports Illustrated \u003ca href=\"https://www.si.com/college/2021/07/01/ncaa-athletes-profit-nil-daily-cover?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow did we get here? \u003c/strong\u003e25 states passed NIL bills that challenged the NCAA’s rules banning student athletes from monetizing their popularity. Seeing the writing on the wall, the NCAA lifted its restrictions on NIL on Wednesday, paving the way for college athletes to link up with brands just hours later.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThey didn’t waste any time\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAn entire roster of college athletes took advantage of the new NIL rules yesterday to launch their business careers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTwin sisters who play for Fresno State’s basketball team are the newest \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/college-sports/story/_/id/31738893/ncaa-athletes-cashing-name-image-likeness?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espokespeople\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for Boost Mobile.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWisconsin’s starting QB Graham Mertz released a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.buckys5thquarter.com/2021/6/28/22554417/graham-mertz-has-a-logo-now-like-a-danged-superhero-nil-name-image-likeness-wisconsin-badgers?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epersonal logo\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eArkansas WR Trey Knox and his incredibly good-looking dog, Blue, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/FOS/status/1410689170306174976?s=09\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einked a deal\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with PetSmart.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you’re thinking NIL will mostly benefit the biggest stars in the biggest sports (football, basketball), you wouldn’t be wrong. But there are plenty of exceptions for the most social media-savvy athletes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor example, industry insiders expect LSU gymnast Olivia Dunne to earn the most of any NCAA athlete from NIL endorsements. She’s the only one with more than 1 million followers on both TikTok and Instagram.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn total, the NIL market could hit \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/oliviaevans/2021/06/24/college-athletes-are-ready-to-reap-the-rewards-of-the-billion-dollar-nil-market-opendorse-is-here-to-help/?sh=477aee164f57\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$500 million\u003c/a\u003e in 2022 and $1 billion/year annually after that, per athlete marketing platform Opendorse. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s next? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo borrow a sports metaphor, we’re in the \u003cem\u003every \u003c/em\u003eearly innings of NIL, so expect chaos. The NCAA’s decision has left a confusing patchwork of state laws governing NIL, and everyone’s waiting on Congress to pass a federal bill that establishes nationwide guidelines. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Further NIL reading: \u003c/strong\u003eThe \u003ca style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etop 20 athletes\u003c/a\u003e who could capitalize on NIL and the \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/espn/feature/story/_/id/29388424/how-much-money-college-athletes-make-nil-rights?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" The trading app will list its shares under the symbol HOOD in an IPO that reflects the growing influence of the individual trader on Wall Street.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRight now, it’s good to be the HOOD.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRobinhood’s revenue \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/online-brokerage-robinhood-makes-ipo-filing-public-2021-07-01/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurged to $959 million\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in 2020, a 245% jump from 2019. It also turned a profit for the first time last year amid a pandemic-fueled trading boom.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eInterest in crypto has been lucrative: Crypto-related transactions accounted for 17% of Robinhood’s total revenue in Q1.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThings can get meta when you have a stock brokerage list shares. For instance, Robinhood wants you to buy into Robinhood’s IPO on Robinhood. In an unusual move, it’s setting aside 20%–35% of its Class A stock for its customers, as opposed to bankers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Robinhood’s highly anticipated IPO is the belle of the ball on a packed dance floor. US-listed IPOs have already raised over \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/robinhood-ipo-filing-shows-power-of-the-meme-stock-boom-11625163113?mod=hp_lead_pos7\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$190 billion\u003c/a\u003e so far in 2021, more than 2020’s style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Race to the Bottom Could Be Over\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt='An illustration of a Monopoly board. The space for taxes shows \"Corporate Tax: Pay 21% or $200\" with the 21% crossed out in red pen and 28% written beside it. ' style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDAzL2NvcnBvcmF0ZV90YXhlcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the past 30 years, countries have lowered their corporate tax rates to lure companies to their shores. That race may be rounding its final turn.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTreasury Secretary Janet Yellen \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/01/business/global-minimum-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that a group of 130 nations, including China and India, have agreed to a 15% global minimum corporate tax. After taking effect in 2023, it will be the biggest change to the international tax system in a century. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eUnder a global minimum tax, multinational corporations would theoretically stop moving their headquarters to tax havens like the British Virgin Islands and Bermuda. Raising rates from the single-digits to at least 15% in those havens will generate $150 billion in additional tax revenue per year, according to the OECD.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“Today’s agreement by 130 countries representing more than 90% of global GDP is a clear sign: the race to the bottom is one step closer to coming to an end,” Yellen \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/SecYellen/status/1410624464799375360?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor President Biden, the minimum tax agreement is a crucial step to make multinational companies pay significantly more in US taxes, which will help fund his ambitious spending plans. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis was the international community’s answer to the complicated question of how to tax tech giants, like Google and Facebook, which have substantial sales in countries they have no physical presence in.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:
